abstract: A type that represents the depth, or amount of memory, for a single pixel in a window or screen.
overview:
## Overview

A depth of `0` indicates default depth. Don’t make window depths persistent because they aren’t the same across systems.

Use the functions [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSWindow/Depth/colorSpaceName], [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSWindow/Depth/bitsPerPixel], and [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSWindow/Depth/isPlanar] to extract info from an `NSWindowDepth` value.

Use [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSBestDepth] to compute window depths. [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSBestDepth] tries to accommodate all the parameters (match or better). If there are multiple matches, this function uses color space first, then bits per sample (`bps`), then `planar`, then bits per pixel (`bpp)` to determine the closest match. Use `0` for `bpp` to indicate the default, the same as the number of bits per plane: either `bps` or `bps` * [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSColorSpaceName/numberOfColorComponents]. You may use other values as hints to provide backing stores of different configurations — for instance, 8-bit color.

You can also use one of the explicit bit depths defined in `Explicit Window Depth Limits` for the `NSWindow` property [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSWindow/depthLimit].

source: https://developer.apple.com/documentation/appkit/nswindow/depth

# NSWindow.Depth

**Enumeration**

A type that represents the depth, or amount of memory, for a single pixel in a window or screen.

## Declaration

```swift
enum Depth
```

## Overview

A depth of `0` indicates default depth. Don’t make window depths persistent because they aren’t the same across systems.

Use the functions [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSWindow/Depth/colorSpaceName], [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSWindow/Depth/bitsPerPixel], and [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSWindow/Depth/isPlanar] to extract info from an `NSWindowDepth` value.

Use [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSBestDepth] to compute window depths. [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSBestDepth] tries to accommodate all the parameters (match or better). If there are multiple matches, this function uses color space first, then bits per sample (`bps`), then `planar`, then bits per pixel (`bpp)` to determine the closest match. Use `0` for `bpp` to indicate the default, the same as the number of bits per plane: either `bps` or `bps` * [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSColorSpaceName/numberOfColorComponents]. You may use other values as hints to provide backing stores of different configurations — for instance, 8-bit color.

You can also use one of the explicit bit depths defined in `Explicit Window Depth Limits` for the `NSWindow` property [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSWindow/depthLimit].

## Constants

- **NSWindow.Depth.onehundredtwentyeightBitRGB**: One hundred and twenty eight bit RGB depth limit.
- **NSWindow.Depth.sixtyfourBitRGB**: Sixty four bit RGB depth limit.
- **NSWindow.Depth.twentyfourBitRGB**: Twenty four bit RGB depth limit.

## Accessing Depth Details

- **availableDepths**: An array that contains all available windows depths.
- **bestDepth(colorSpaceName:bitsPerSample:bitsPerPixel:isPlanar:)**: Determines the best window depth that most closely matches the given properties.
- **bitsPerPixel**: Returns the bits per pixel for the specified window depth.
- **bitsPerSample**: Returns the bits per sample for the specified window depth.
- **colorSpaceName**: Returns the name of the color space corresponding to the passed window depth.
- **isPlanar**: Returns whether the specified window depth is planar.

## Initializers

- **init(rawValue:)**

## Constants

- **NSWindow.SelectionDirection**: Constants that specify the direction a window is currently using to change the key view.
- **NSWindow.ButtonType**: Constants that provide a way to access standard title bar buttons.
- **NSRunLoop—Ordering Modes for NSWindow**: Constants that specify the priority for runloop messages.
- **NSWindow.BackingStoreType**: Constants that specify how the window device buffers the drawing done in a window.
- **NSWindow.OrderingMode**: Constants that let you specify how a window is ordered relative to another window.
- **NSWindow.SharingType**: Constants that represent the access levels other processes can have to a window’s content.
- **NSWindow.NumberListOptions**: Options to use when retrieving window numbers from the system.
- **NSWindow.AnimationBehavior**: Constants that control the automatic window animation behavior windows use when ordering to the front or out of view.
- **NSWindow.CollectionBehavior**: Window collection behaviors related to Mission Control, Spaces, and Stage Manager.
- **NSWindow.OcclusionState**: Specifies whether the window is occluded.
- **NSWindow.TitleVisibility**: Specifies the appearance of the window’s title bar area.
- **NSWindow.UserTabbingPreference**: A value that indicates the user’s preference for window tabbing.
- **NSWindow.TabbingMode**: The preferred tabbing behavior of a window.
- **Application Kit Version for Deferred Window Display Support**: The version of the AppKit.framework containing a specific bug fix or capability.
- **Application Kit Version for Custom Sheet Position**: The version of the AppKit.framework containing a specific bug fix or capability.

## Conforms To

- BitwiseCopyable
- Equatable
- Hashable
- RawRepresentable
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
